Ship Switching Overview:

I've played a lot of games, space sims included - often I would see a ship piloted by friend or foe and want to pilot that ship. However space sims usually only let you pilot one ship per mission. There are space sims that let you change ships - but this tended to be a somewhat of an involved experience. So in making my own game - one of the goals was to make ship switching easy.

The idea behind ship switching is that enjoyment comes from options, that different ships are suited for different tasks, and that games are dynamic so situations arise that you might need to change to another ship.

Potential Reasons to switch ships:
You might not want to risk a cruiser in an asteroid field, but risking drones is ok and you'll provide cover in one of them.
You might not send in your main fleet, but a wing of fighters to soften up defences is a path to victory - and you'll pilot a bomber.
A large ship has particularly good turret coverage to deal with swarms of fighters or drones.
Maybe a cruiser is in trouble and needs to evade incoming ships.
Maybe you want to manually dock a marine frigate to a base - charging in using afterburners to evade enemy fire.
To accommodate ship switching - game mechanics:
A fighter dying isn't the end of the game when you have the command ship.
Most ships can be re-built - ok to take risks
Command ship health is displayed in the upper right hand corner, so you can easily track it.
You can track other ship's health via the watched objects GUIs.
You can slow down time to pick a ship to switch to or get a heads up on the tactical situation that might require a different ship.
A variety of ships exist - including a variety of primary and secondary weapons.
Some strategy gamers might like to sit exclusively in a large ship - and that is a ok - but I hope those that for those that enjoy switching ships - Void Destroyer gives you opportunities.
